info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 12:43PM EDT until April 16 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana...
Wabash River.
Wildcat Creek near Lafayette.
.Lowland flooding has developed along the length of the Wabash River due to rainfall of generally three to eight inches in the Wabash basin. Significant flooding is expected to develop on the lower Wabash, with Mount Carmel surpassing moderate flood stage on Monday. The crest on the Wabash was approaching Lafayette this afternoon and is expected to reach Mount Carmel around Saturday April 12.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wabash River at Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site.
* WHEN...Until Wednesday, April 16.
* IMPACTS...At 22.8 feet, Flooding extends to what is locally called River Road in several areas. River Road is the rural way south from Hutsonville to Palestine. Flooding in this area affects large expanses of agricultural land, river cabins and hunting areas on both sides of the river. Most local, unimproved roads leading towards the river are flooded. These roads led to farms, river cabins, private residences, levees and a few oil wells.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.5 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday, April 15. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued late tonight by around 345 AM EDT /245 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY, APRIL 16

area.areaDesc: Crawford, IL; Lawrence, IL; Knox, IN; Sullivan, IN
